title: Define Project Scope and Requirements - v2
description: Revised document detailing the ThreatSimulationEngine's requirements. This revision includes clarification on the types of cyber threats to be simulated (e.g., phishing, malware, DDoS attacks), the testing scenarios, desired outputs (including real-time analytics and reporting mechanisms), performance expectations (processing power, response times, etc.), and potential integration with existing security systems. Additionally, it outlines the need for modularity to accommodate future threat types and updates. The document also includes a section on user roles and permissions, and an improved explanation of the system's functionalities, focusing on its ability to simulate complex and realistic cyber threats. It further discusses the importance of ensuring data privacy and security within the system. Finally, it suggests the need for regular updates and improvements based on feedback from users and changing threat landscapes. The document is now ready for review and approval. Please find attached the revised document.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including the components, modules, and their interactions, as well as the data flow and security considerations.

title: Develop Threat Simulation Engine
description: Implement the core engine responsible for simulating various cyber threats based on the defined scenarios and configurations.

title: Implement Testing Environment
description: Set up the controlled testing environment where the simulated threats will be executed and monitored.

title: Develop User Interface
description: Create the user interface for configuring and running simulations, as well as viewing and analyzing the results.

title: Implement Reporting and Analytics
description: Develop the reporting and analytics components to generate comprehensive reports and insights from the simulation results.

title: Set up Database and Data Storage
description: Design and implement the database schema and data storage mechanisms for storing simulation configurations, results, and other relevant data.

title: Implement Security Measures
description: Ensure the system is secure by implementing appropriate security measures, such as access controls, data encryption, and auditing mechanisms.

title: Create Test Plans and Test Cases
description: Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases to validate the functionality, performance, and security of the ThreatSimulationEngine.

title: Conduct System Testing
description: Execute the test plans and test cases, identify and report any issues or defects, and ensure the system meets the defined requirements.

description: Plan and execute the deployment and release of the ThreatSimulationEngine to the production environment, ensuring smooth operations and minimal downtime.
